data.title: Improve on inconsistent language: Side Bar vs Activity Bar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5)
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18.1 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the View Menu
2. Observe the following options:
   * Move Side Bar [Right/Left]
   * Toggle Side Bar
   * ...
   * Hide Activity Bar

Here we have both "Side Bar" and "Activity Bar" referring to the Vertical Menu and drawer.  It seems "Side Bar" is supposed to refer to the expanded part and "Activity Bar"; however, this is not very discoverable and the Activity Bar can reasonably expected to be the referenced Side Bar.  The "Activity Bar" is *a sidebar* and it moves when I choose "Move Side Bar" and the drawer I perceive as attached to it expands/collapses (shows/hides) when I choose "Toggle Side Bar."  However, when I want to hide it I need an option related to the "Activity Bar" rather than the "Side Bar." (In my case I had to come to GitHub and search issues to find that the behavior I was looking for was that option).

edit: [there is evidence I am not the only person to encounter this confusion](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15310#issuecomment-259962222)
___

## Suggestions

Assuming the current names are to be kept, I recommend the following changes:

* Standardize on Toggle or [Show/Hide].
So either "Toggle Activity Bar" or "[Show/Hide] Side Bar".  This helps to put widgets on equal footing and the consistency helps to lessen the possible association that "Toggling" the side bar changes the state or the Activity Bar rather than showing/hiding an independent widget. (Note: This would apply to more than this entry)

* Make "Move Side Bar [Right/Left]", "Move Activity Bar [Left/Right]"
This helps to establish the name "Activity Bar" and explains why the option moves the Activity Bar when the option is selected and not just the Side Bar.

data.title: delayed app-ready event

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: We see traces in which Electron takes a very long time to to receive the `app-ready` event. Because we cannot do anything useful before that happens it blocks startup badly.

data.title: tryListenOnPipe can be slow
data.body: We are receiving traces that `tryListenOnPipe` is slow and takes up to 1sec

data.title: Select more files to open from "Go to File" dialog
data.body:
Hi!

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. press Cmd+P to open Go to File dialog
2. find some file pattern (which e.g. in JS project matches a File and its FileSpec file)
3. ...and here, I'm not able to open more files at once.

E.g. by pressing Shift any Down to select more files to be opened...or select them by Ctrl (Cmd)+click and opening them by Return. I must open one file, invoke Go to File again, again write a pattern and select another file. It's too lengthy :(

Thanks a lot!

data.title: Extensions not loading in 1.11
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install at least one extension say vscode.eslint
2. Open extensions folder using command  `Open Extensions Folder`
3. Make sure that there is a folder named `vscode.eslint-x.y.z`. x.y.z is version number.
4. Clone the folder by copy-paste and rename it to `vscode-eslint`
5. Refresh VS Code

And you see error `Invalid Version: null` and extensions are not running. See the pic below.

![2017-03-06_10-19-45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6662208/23618609/751c5cee-0256-11e7-88b3-fb6bc8b1dd62.png)


I upgraded to 1.11.0-insider and extensions will no longer load. It looks to be similar to #19753 

``` 
TypeError: Invalid Version: null
    at new SemVer (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\node_modules\semver\semver.js:281:11)
    at SemVer.compare (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\node_modules\semver\semver.js:348:13)
    at compare (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\node_modules\semver\semver.js:571:31)
    at Function.rcompare (C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\node_modules\semver\semver.js:581:10)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:86:16549
    at Array.sort (native)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:86:16521
    at Array.map (native)
    at file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:86:16496
    at Object.g [as _notify] (file:///C:/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Insiders/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.main.js:32:10899)
[Extension Host] git (vscode.git) uses PROPOSED API which is subject to change and removal without notice
```

Furthermore I noticed that some parameters tags were missing from other functions, for instance the `insert` function. I can also add those if that is desired

data.title: Consider to support a server mode for debug adapters
data.body:
Today VS Code starts a new debug adapter process for every debug session.

Only in "debug adapter development mode" we support to have a debug adapter running as a server and to have VS Code just connect to it for a debug session.

We should consider to make the "server mode" an official run option for debug adapters. 

/cc @isidorn @daviwil

data.title: vscode.extensions.getExtension case sensitivity behavior has changed
data.body:
- VSCode Version: VS Code Insiders from last Friday (see screenshot)
- OS Version: Windows 10

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79405/23614236/1c966fac-0237-11e7-9fda-7df5378abc3d.png)


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use `vscode.extensions.getExtension` to get an extension with capital letters (like `ms-vscode.PowerShell`)
2. `getExtension` returns null
3. Call `getExtension` with all characters of extension name lowercased (like `ms-vscode.powershell`)
4. Extension details are returned

This is a **breaking change** because it means I can't support both VS Code 1.10.1 and Insiders concurrently if I change my extension code to adjust to this.  VS Code 1.10.1 allows me to get extension details for `ms-vscode.PowerShell` with that exact casing and returns null if I give it `ms-vscode.powershell`.  

I'm currently using this API to get the current version of my extension to send to my language server.

Any idea what might have changed to cause this?  I'd like to ship an update to my extension soon and I think this bug might cause trouble for my users.

data.title: Surface new Exception DAP in UI
data.body:
In the last milestone we've added new debug adapter protocol to retrieve [information about a thrown exception](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/97) and we've introduced a peek UI [to show this information to the user](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16860).

Now we have to bring both things together.

data.body: To make the debug actions more discoverable, we should add a debug menu.

data.body: Please make built-in php formatter or make flexible settings to do own formatting rules

data.title: Pull in latest translations
Publicly monitor power-usage progress
data.body:
VSCode is obscenely inefficient with battery-power. With Notepad++ I can get 4 to 5 hours. With VSCode I'd be lucky to get 2.5 hours.

This is not a duplicate of #16963 (uses significant energy); I would like the VSCode team publicly track power-usage in the same fashion Mozilla track browser speed with https://arewefastyet.com

If this is not charted and publicly displayed I feel that power-usage will forever be an after-thought and serious regressions could occur unless an eye is being kept on it for every release.

Thanks very much BTW for the great editor.

data.title: Allow reporting of extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
We need to clean up our marketplace quick! Some extensions are starting to deprecate and worse, get abandoned. Due to most people downloading top-rated or top-downloaded extensions, this could mean hours of frustration only to find out this extension/s are broken.

**Please allow the ability to report/ flag extensions for either breakage or plagiarism via the marketplace and/or extension page.**

Take for example:

PHP Code format;
https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Kasik96.format-indent

One of the highlight downloaded formatting tools and yet, check the reviews. (Repo and issues page are MIA btw). I think there needs to be better moderation on our marketplace if we want it to grow properly.

Would love to hear people's input on it.

data.title: For files with long rows the word wrap features only works on newly created empty tabs.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Linux 4.4.0-64-generic #85~14.04.1-Ubuntu SMP x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Commit 653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5
- Date 2017-03-02T00:47:58.633Z
- Shell 1.4.6
- Renderer 53.0.2785.143
- Node 6.5.0

description:
the word wrap works perfectly with files containing short lines. But once the lines become too long (2375 characters in my example) the word wrap feature works only on newly opened empty tabs, once i save the tab's content into a new file or i change the tab, the word wrap features does not work anymore.

just to make sure it is not a settings problem, below are my settings for for version 1.9.* and 1.10.1:
- 1.9.1
    "editor.wordWrap": false
    "editor.wordWrapColumn": 300000
- 1.10.1
    "editor.wordWrap": "off"

prerequisites :
 - a file saved on the hard drive with rows containing 2375 characters.
 - word wrap feature toggled off.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open the file save, the the content is wrapped.
2. open a new tab by pressing Ctrl+N, and copy the content of the file into the new tab, the content is not wrapped and i can side scroll until the end.
3. save the file into the hard drive, the content is wrapped.
4. open another new tab by pressing Ctrl+N, and copy the content of the file into the new tab, the content is not wrapped.
5. go to another tab, and go back to the previous tab, the content is wrapped.

data.title: Explorer how to leverage Transifex to translate VS Code
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Currently VS Code is translated using MS internal translation platform. We should explore if we can leverage Transifex to translate VS Code in the open.

data.title: Define extension story for tasks
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Out of the box VS Code ships with a set of predefined task templates. Since VS Code 1.9 we also support defining more than one command in the tasks.json. Hence the value of a template is not huge anymore since most users will use different commands in a tasks.json.

However extension like C# or C++ want to contribute to the tasks.json to ensure that a build tasks for example executes a C++ specific build script. 

We need to define how extensions best participate in running builds and tests.

data.title: Investigate better UX for previewing things
data.body:
~~People use `previewHtml` for building UI which does't work well. We should investigate different options~~~

We will tackle the problem from the other side: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/22068#issuecomment-293903020

data.title: Allow extensions to participate in tasks using commands

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

Currently the task framework can only trigger external commands (programs or shell scripts). Since Ctrl+Shift+B is taken by the task framework we should allow extension to participate in 'build' and 'test' (and any other composite task) by executing a command in the extension itself.

data.title: Allow extensions to contribute named problem matchers via package.json
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

VS Code currently ships with a predefined set of named problem matchers. Since extension include external tools (and compilers) we should allow extensions to contribute problem matchers via the package.json.

data.title: Help users to migrate to new tasks.json version 2.0.0.

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:

Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.1.0

To make use of the task execution in the terminal users need to migrate to version 2.0.0 of tasks.json. Support this migration path with a automatic conversion of version 0.1.0 to 2.0.0.

data.title: "Format Selection" doesn't work with Multi Select
data.body:
* **Operating System**: Windows 10 Home (v1607; 14393.693)
* **VS Code Version**: 1.10.1

## Action performed
* Open file (for instance HTML file)
* Select part of the code
* While holding ALT (Option key on Mac), select more code somewhere else in the file (=VSCode's multi-select feature)
* "Format Selection"

## Expected results
* both sections should be formatted

## Actual results
* only the section selected first is formatted
